snippet: Employees said Bloomberg News chose not to publish investigative articles about China’s leadership because of worries that it would be evicted from the country.
abstract: Employees say Bloomberg News chose not to publish investigative articles about China’s leadership because of worries that it would be evicted from country; revelation casts new light on dilemma that numerous foreign new organizations confront as they navigate pressures of doing both journalism and business in China.

byline.contributor: Christine Haughney contributed reporting from New York, and employees of The New York Times from Hong Kong and Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Employees said Bloomberg News chose not to publish investigative articles about China’s leadership because of worries that it would be evicted from the country.

headline.main: Bloomberg News Is Said to Curb Articles That Might Anger China
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg News Is Said to Curb Articles That Might Anger China
